How do I define and launch a new currency on the Verus platform, and what are the requirements for launching a currency?

To define and launch a new currency on the Verus platform, you need to use the `definecurrency` command. This command allows you to specify the properties of the new currency, such as its name, options, and conversion rates.

Here's an example of how to define a new currency called "gold":

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"gold","options":96,"currencies":["vrsctest"],"conversions":[0.01],"minpreconversion":[1000],"preallocations":[{"mike@":50000000.00000000}]}'
```

This command defines a new currency called "gold" with specific properties, such as a conversion rate of 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD and a minimum preconversion amount of 1000 VRSCTEST.

To launch the currency, you need to fund the identity of the currency with at least 10 VRSCTEST. Then, you need to send a transaction with the defined currency properties to initiate the currency launch. The launch will start 50 blocks from when the transaction was made, and it requires 1000 VRSCTEST to be preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD.

After the currency launches, you can convert VRSCTEST to GOLD using the `sendcurrency` command. For example:

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```

This command will park your conversion until the token launches, and then you will either receive 0.975 GOLD in your wallet or have your VRSCTEST returned.

It's also possible to create new tokens that can be converted to with either GOLD or VRSCTEST. This is done by defining a new currency with the `definecurrency` command, specifying the conversion rates and other properties.

Note that the launch of a currency is part of the mining process, and miners who participate in the launch earn a 0.025% conversion fee.

./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"gold","options":96,"currencies":["vrsctest"],"conversions":[0.01],"minpreconversion":[1000],"preallocations":[{"mike@":50000000.00000000}]}'
```
